definition: to exceed/to overtake/to surpass/to transcend/to pass/to cross/ultra-/super-
to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt

sentences.english: In fact, the S&P is nearly short-term oversold following recent consolidation.
sentences.chinese: 事实上经过近期整理之后，标普短期几乎已超卖。

sentences.english: A security can become overbought or oversold for an extended period of time.
sentences.chinese: 可以成为一个安全买或超卖的一段较长的时间。

sentences.english: And this suggests that the short-term oversold rebound could turn out to be something bigger.
sentences.chinese: 这意味著这一波短期超卖反弹还将持续下去。

definition: to fall back (of water level or share prices)
bull market (prices appear to be rising)
moving average index (used in financial analysis)
(of a market index etc) to fall below (a given level)/to be injured or damaged as a result of a fall
to bounce/to bounce back/to boomerang/to ricochet/rebound (of stock market etc)/bounce/backlash/negative repercussions
